head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Deadline For Grants

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Deadline For Grants

body.head.byline: By Edward Wyatt (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Lower Manhattan residents have until May 31 to apply for up to $14,000 in federal grants being offered to increase population of downtown and help recovery from Sept 11 attack on World Trade Center (S)

block.p: Residents of Lower Manhattan have until Saturday to apply for up to $14,500 in grants through a federal program meant to increase the residential population of downtown and help the area recover from the Sept. 11 attack on the World Trade Center. The Lower Manhattan Development Corporation is administering the $306 million program, which offers grants to residents of three zones in Lower Manhattan. Most of the grants require two years' residency. Details are available at the development corporation's Web site, www.renewnyc.com, or by calling (866) 736-3969.
